title: Google\Cloud\OsConfig\V1\OSPolicy\Resource\FileResource
name: FileResource
description:
A resource that manages the state of a file.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.osconfig.v1.OSPolicy.Resource.FileResource

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.content
params.description: A a file with this content. The size of the content is limited to 1024 characters.

params.name: data.path
params.description: Required. The absolute path of the file within the VM.

params.name: data.permissions
params.description: Consists of three octal digits which represent, in order, the permissions of the owner, group, and other users for the file (similarly to the numeric mode used in the linux chmod utility). Each digit represents a three bit number with the 4 bit corresponding to the read permissions, the 2 bit corresponds to the write bit, and the one bit corresponds to the execute permission. Default behavior is 755. Below are some examples of permissions and their associated values: read, write, and execute: 7 read and execute: 5 read and write: 6 read only: 4

methods.name: getPermissions
methods.description:
Consists of three octal digits which represent, in order, the permissions of the owner, group, and other users for the file (similarly to the numeric mode used in the linux chmod utility). Each digit represents a three bit number with the 4 bit corresponding to the read permissions, the 2 bit corresponds to the write bit, and the one bit corresponds to the execute permission.

Default behavior is 755. Below are some examples of permissions and their associated values: read, write, and execute: 7 read and execute: 5 read and write: 6 read only: 4

Generated from protobuf field string permissions = 5;

Default behavior is 755. Below are some examples of permissions and their associated values: read, write, and execute: 7 read and execute: 5 read and write: 6 read only: 4
